page.title: 02HISTORY - SAXON AND NORMAN
page.content: {HISTORY OF WESTBURY Westbury is a Saxon name meaning west fort which was sited on a low mound lying to the north of the present church.2\kms.SW lie the ditch and bank of Beaumont Castle, a similar site. Arnold Cilt held in 1086 a manor of 2\ hides (roughly 300 acres),land enough for 7 ploughs with 2 more on the demesne.In addition 8 villeins and 5 bordars had 5 ploughs.250 swine fed in the surrounding woodland. Altogether it was worth 3 pounds.The saxon Cilt,thegn of Edward the Confessor, had lost the land at the time of the Conquest so that by 1086 it was Roger de Ivery who held the land of Odo, Bishop of Bayeux and half brother of William. Although the manorial rights changed hands many times over the years, Westbury remained a manor until 1931.
